script.name: Liz
script.line: It's so sweet of you to walk me to work today.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: You're my girl, right? I take care of you, huh?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Who knows? Maybe we'll see Natalie Morales, you know? That little firecracker. She gets my blood running south of the border.

script.name: Liz
script.line: That is less sweet.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: I'm gonna stop by tonight. Maybe I'll, uh, pick up some Chinese.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Aw. You said "Chinese" instead of something offensive.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: I told you, losing you last year changed me, huh? It made me more, um... more mature. Come here.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Ow. That really hurts! Dennis!

script.name: Jenna
script.line: You're back with Dennis?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah. I'm back with Dennis. Don't look at me with your eyebrows all up. It's so annoying.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Oh, yes. I'm annoying. Not the man who honked your boobs on the jumbo screen.

script.name: Liz
script.line: That was before, and it was the playoffs.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Does he still work at that beeper store? What is it, Beeper King?

script.name: Liz
script.line: He is the king now. The old Beeper King retired. Well, technically, he shot himself. But Dennis took over, and now he's the only beeper salesman left in Manhattan, which is cool.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You're doing the eyebrow thing again.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Because it's Dennis. Who are you trying to fool? This is me.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Exactly. You don't get to give dating advice. You sent a letter to Scott Peterson.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: After he dyed his hair and got super thin from all the stress. Are you kidding me? He was smokin'.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Dennis is a good guy, okay?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Not really. So, when did this happen?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Well, last week was my birthday. And everyone forgot except Dennis. He called, and we went out, and it wasn't too weird.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: And how was the sex?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Fast and only on Saturdays. It's perfect.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Did you see this? It's horrible.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: They're printing libel about me again. Libel, Liz Lemon!

script.name: Liz
script.line: Ugh! "Normal." How dare they?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: That's what I'm saying. That's character assassination.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: That's not normal. It only looks like I'm walking out of a Starbucks, when actually I'm doing the robot going backwards into a Starbucks. And I don't even know whose dog that is.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Yes, I steal dogs.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What is the problem?

I can't be normal. If I'm normal, I'm boring. If I'm boring, I'm not a movie star. If I'm not a movie star, then I'm poor. And poor people can't afford to pay back the $75,000 in cash they owe Quincy Jones.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Wow. Talking to that guy is like looking in a mirror, huh?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Well, my armpit rash is back. Oh, my God, Jack. What are you doing in wardrobe?

script.name: Jack
script.line: The latest research is in. Our audience doesn't like green.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Oh, that's too bad. I like green.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Research doesn't lie, Jenna. It lets us know what we're thinking... what's too boring, what's too gay, what's too old.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: What's too old?

script.name: Jack
script.line: That's a very good question. How old are you?.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: I'm 29

script.name: Jack
script.line: What year were you born?.

script.name: Jack
script.line: When did you graduate high school?.

script.name: Jack
script.line: When do you turn 40?.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Junior high crush?.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Kirk Cameron

script.name: Jack
script.line: Prom theme?.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: "Motownphilly," Boyz II Men

script.name: Jack
script.line: What movie did you lose your virginity at?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: "Arachnophobia."

script.name: Jack
script.line: Theater or drive-in?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: What's a drive-in?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Of course. I don't know why I bothered to ask.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I can tell just from your physical appearance that you're obviously... 29.

script.name: Liz
script.line: So, these page numbers, when done correctly, should be sequential.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: Oh. Oh, Josh, Liz Taylor's assistant called. They wanted the address here to send you something.

script.name: Josh
script.line: That's awesome! She must have seen my impression of her.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Sounds like someone loves Liz Taylor.

script.name: Josh
script.line: I do

script.name: Toofer
script.line: No, we mean love love.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Yeah, like if she walked in right now and said she wanted to do it with you, you would.

script.name: Josh
script.line: I definitely would.

script.name: Frank
script.line: What?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Liz.

script.name: Josh
script.line: I'm totally serious. I mean, wouldn't you guys?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Uh, Jack asked me how old I am.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What did you say?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Jenna, relax.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: I cannot and will not relax, Liz.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: I am an actress, and when someone asks an actress how old she is, it's more statement than question.

script.name: Cerie
script.line: When my mom's feeling old, she goes to this guy on 71 st Street. But she's old. She's like 38.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: I'm gonna be sick.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Betcha he reads Betcha she sews Betcha they've made me a closet of clothes

script.name: Liz
script.line: God.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Lemon, what tragedy happened in your life that you insist upon punishing yourself with all this... mediocrity?

script.name: Liz
script.line: What, 'cause I'm eating a turkey sub?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Your turkey sub, your clothes, the fact that a woman of your resources and position lives like some boxcar hobo.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Or maybe it's the fact that while I'm saying all this, you have a piece of lettuce stuck in your hair.

script.name: Jack
script.line: This is the unlisted number of Stone, the most exclusive restaurant in the city, currently.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I think it's time that you start enjoying some of the finer things in life.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Completely unsolicited and inappropriate.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I will only accept it because I love food.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Do you know why Jack Welch is the greatest leader since the Pharaohs?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Because he didn't only involve himself in our work lives, but our personal lives as well.

script.name: Jack
script.line: He introduced us to the finest booze, the most restrictive country clubs. He gave us the names of the most discrete private investigators to spy on our ex-wives. He held our hands during our triumphs and our Senate hearings.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I want to hold your hand, Lemon.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yikes.

script.name: Jack
script.line: This is a perfect example. You have a million-dollar view. But you refuse to acknowledge that there's a whole world out there.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Oh, my. There appears to be a gentleman making passionate, anguine love to himself.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah, I know. That's why I closed the blinds in the first place.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Right in his office. Huh.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Lemon, I like to think of myself as a winner, and I like to surround myself with winners. I see potential in you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Let me be your Jack Welch. Let me be your mentor.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, thank you.

script.name: Jack
script.line: That is unfortunate.

script.name: Jack
script.line: You've, uh, got to admire his persistence and stamina, though. Am I wrong, or is he in the middle of a staff meeting?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Maybe you should be his mentor.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Obviously, he doesn't need one. He's got it all figured out.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: I got one for you. See the old guy over there with the girl? Mistress or daughter?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, my God. I hope it's his daughter.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Yeah. Me too.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, my God! I hope it's his mistress. Oh, that is just wrong.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Hey, 007, how about some more rolls over here, huh?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Oh, my, my. What a pleasant surprise. Lemon. And you brought a man.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Jack Donaghy. And this is my friend Anastasia. How are you?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Hi. Dennis Duffy, Beeper King.

script.name: Jack
script.line: The Beeper King. Really?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Uh, Dennis has his own business. Yes, he's an entrepreneur. He's very successful.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: You probably see my ads on the 7 train, right?

script.name: Jack
script.line: I didn't know they served chicken nuggets at this restaurant.

script.name: Liz
script.line: It's cod. It's, uh... They made it special. Dennis has some dietary restrictions.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Actually, I'm allergic to all fish unless it's fried, you know?

script.name: Jack
script.line: That's a sharp tie you've got there, Dennis.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: That douche bag up front made me wear it.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Does he know you're the Beeper King?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: I don't think so.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Anyway, thanks for the hookup. This is clearly the nicest restaurant we've ever been to.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Oh, hold on a second. This place ain't that nice, all right? It's got rats and roaches like every other restaurant.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No rat talk tonight, okay?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Do you know there are 17 rats per person in Manhattan? You eat a pound of rat crap every year without even knowing it.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I think I read about that in The New Yorker.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Anyway, we'll leave you to your meal. I hope you enjoy the, uh, choices that you've made.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Stop it.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: And that former call girl went on to become one of NBC's biggest news anchors.

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Star coming. Wall hug, everybody.

script.name: Lady
script.line: That's Tracy Jordan! He seems like such a nice, normal young man.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Aah!

script.name: Kenneth
script.line: Let's keep going, you guys. Let's keep going.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I enjoyed the restaurant. Thank you.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Just say it. Just say what you're dying to say.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Dennis is nice to me, okay? He fixed my toilet. He broke it first, but he fixed it.

script.name: Liz
script.line: And he loves hockey, and I'm... figuring it out.

script.name: Liz
script.line: And it's easy. I get a lot of work done. I don't have time for a personal life, okay?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I can't just go to Central Park and join the singles' touch-football league.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Like I'd want to, anyway. People on those posters always laughing in their sweaters. God, who are they fooling?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, okay, you're not gonna say anything to me because I rejected you as a mentor?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Who cares? I have a lot of friends I can talk to about my life.

script.name: Liz
script.line: The bottom line is, Dennis is my boyfriend because he inquired. He was the only applicant. And I am not... ...doing great.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Come in.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hey, do you have a minute? I need to talk to you about... Aah! What did you do to yourself?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Me? Oh, nothing. Just getting more rest. Drinking more water.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Really? This water... does someone boil it first and throw it in your face?

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Okay, I had a little Botox and some collagen and a chemical peel and something with shark DNA. Admit it. I look 10 years younger.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, younger even. You look like a fetus.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I came here to talk to you about my problems with Dennis.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Oh, I can't right now, honey. If I don't do my facial exercises, I could wind up looking weird.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I just mentioned Dennis, and your eyebrows didn't go up.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: They didn't?

script.name: Liz
script.line: No.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: How about now?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Unh-unh.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Anything?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Hey, what's up, baby? Liz around?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: She should be back soon. Is that a present for her?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Yeah. If she doesn't get back soon, I'm poking air holes in it.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Excuse me. I couldn't help but notice that, uh, none of you are wearing beepers.

script.name: Frank
script.line: You sell beepers?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: I sell a way of life, my friend.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Cool. I could use some ironic accessories.

script.name: Liz
script.line: What are you doing here?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Hey. I brought you a present.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Uh-oh. Oh, no. It got out. If anyone sees a salamander, it's Liz's, okay?

script.name: Liz
script.line: No. I don't want a salamander. And I don't want you here selling beepers.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Why not? I mean, you work in a business. Businesspeople need beepers.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, they need cellphones.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Oh, yeah, for now. But the beeper's gonna be making a comeback. Technology's cyclical.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, technology is not cyclical.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I thought I recognized that voice. Dennis, how the heck are you? Did you enjoy that restaurant?

script.name: Dennis
script.line: No. I think I was right about that place. We saw a whole nest of rats when we were leaving.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, we didn't.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Yeah, I did. I didn't want to tell you 'cause I knew you'd freak out.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Actually, I think I saw a rat king.

script.name: Frank
script.line: Aren't rat kings a myth?

script.name: Cerie
script.line: What's a rat king?

script.name: Frank
script.line: Oh, it's when a bunch of rats are crammed into a tiny space, and their tails get all tangled up, and they can't even pull apart.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: And then it gets awesome. Eventually their bodies fuse together, and they form a multiheaded live rat king, and we saw one.

script.name: Jack
script.line: I hope you got a picture of that with the camera on your beeper.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Actually, my beeper doesn't have a camera. But it does have a pedometer. Actually, not this one.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Listen, I need to talk to you in my office, please.

script.name: Dennis
script.line: Why? Now.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Now.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: What's up?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Is that a tattoo?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Uh-huh. Who normal now? You hear me, America? Who's normal now?

script.name: Liz
script.line: How could you do this to the show?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I got this tattoo for the good of the show. It gives us an edge... the reason why you brought me on. And when you purchase Tracy Jordan, he comes with a tattoo of a biblical dragon from outer space.

script.name: Pete
script.line: It's gonna take forever to cover this with makeup.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: You can't put makeup on my tattoo, Liz Lemon. It's in my contract.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No, it's not.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Actually, he's got a pretty weird contract.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Great... Jenna looks like a porn-star burn victim, and now this idiot. What are we gonna do?

script.name: Pete
script.line: It's gonna be Josh's busiest show ever.

script.name: Liz Taylor
script.line: Josh.

script.name: Josh
script.line: Ms. Taylor.

script.name: Josh
script.line: When your office said you were sending me something, I didn't realize it would be you.

script.name: Liz Taylor
script.line: But I had to give you this gift... in person, Josh.

script.name: Josh
script.line: Oh. I'm just glad you weren't offended by my impression.

script.name: Liz Taylor
script.line: Oh. But I was. Deeply.

script.name: Liz Taylor
script.line: I'm here to give you the gift of pain.

script.name: Josh
script.line: The gift of what?

script.name: Liz Taylor
script.line: White Diamonds! Aah!

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay. Very funny. You bought a pager from Dennis. Will you take it off now, please?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Oh, I can't. I'm expecting a call from 1983.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Look, Dennis takes care of me, okay?

script.name: Jack
script.line: Liz, I'd like you to meet Howard Jorgensen.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: Liz, how do you do?

script.name: Jack
script.line: He's the vice president of locomotives and a rising star at G. E. I thought the two of you had a lot in common.

script.name: Liz
script.line: You are relentless.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Look, Howard, you're obviously an attractive and confident guy. And at a different time in my life, I could definitely see the two of us together.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: I'm married with two beautiful kids and a pool.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Liz, I wasn't trying to set you up. I wanted to show you my handiwork. I used to mentor Howard.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: I was a lot like you. I dressed poorly, had bad posture, walked around with lettuce in my hair.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, son of a bitch.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: And I cursed like a sailor. But Jack saw potential in me. He changed my life.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Now Howard's earning seven figures, and he's married to a swell Filipino gal.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: Thanks, Jack.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Look, I told you, I don't need a mentor.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Fine.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Liz Taylor really messed him up. He might have brain damage.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, my God. Maybe the musical guest can do some extra songs this week. Who is it?

script.name: Pete
script.line: James Blunt.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Mm.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No. I said no lettuce.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Are you at that crappy sandwich place again?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Yeah, why is everybody judging all of my choices lately?

script.name: Liz
script.line: This place is fine. It's convenient. It's consistent. I know what I'm getting. It doesn't make me feel bad about my body. Maybe I'm at an age where it's okay for me to settle for this.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Are we still talking about the sandwich place?

script.name: Liz
script.line: No. Sadly, I don't think we are.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Okay. I admit it. Dennis isn't a sandwich I want to eat every day for the rest of my life.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I'm clueless about men. I'm clueless about everything that isn't this show. Maybe you can tell me how to live, because, sadly, you may be the most stable person I know right now.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Gentlemen, we'll have to continue this conference some other time.

script.name: Jorgensen
script.line: That's her again, isn't it?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Hi, Howard.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Lemon, today is the first day of the rest of your life. And what is the first thing you need to do?

script.name: Liz
script.line: I have to break up with Dennis.

script.name: Jack
script.line: And why is that?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Because he wears shirts with the Looney Tunes embroidered on them. Because he cuts his own hair. Because that one little nice thing that he does doesn't make up for the fact that I don't want to be seen with him in public.

script.name: Jack
script.line: And if you don't break up with him now?

script.name: Liz
script.line: He'll just keeping showing up at work to sell beepers. He'll just keep calling my mother to borrow money. We'll just get more and more tangled up in each other's lives until I just can't even get away and we're just like...

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, my God.

script.name: Jack
script.line: That's right. He's the rat king. And there's only one way to break up with a rat. You have to cut him off completely.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I know.

script.name: Jack
script.line: You have to stuff your heart with steel wool and tinfoil. You must be ruthless. You must be absolute.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Remember always, you are the exterminator. Say it.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I am the exterminator.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Say it like you mean it.

script.name: Liz
script.line: I am the exterminator.

script.name: Jack
script.line: Louder!

script.name: Liz
script.line: I am the exterminator!

script.name: Jack
script.line: Okay. Not that loud. People are trying to work around here, okay? Okay.

script.name: PA
script.line: 30 minutes to dress rehearsal, everybody.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Tracy, they need you in wardrobe.

script.name: PA
script.line: That's 30 minutes to dress.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Why is part of your face still on the pillow?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Damn it. Where's my Sharpie?

script.name: Liz
script.line: Oh, it is fake.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: Look, I'm crazy, not stupid. A movie star can't have a big old permanent face tattoo.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I just need to walk around with this for a week, get my picture on the interweb, show the world I'm still dangerous!

script.name: Liz
script.line: What about next week, when you don't have it anymore? You're gonna look like...

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I had extreme plastic surgery to have it removed. Baboom! There's another "not normal."

script.name: Liz
script.line: You know this is very, very, very bad for me, right?

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I need to protect my reputation. You take away my street cred, and I am Wayne Brady.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Nuh-uh. Wayne Brady has three Emmys. You have a People's Choice Award that you stole from Wayne Brady.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: I shouldn't expect a white woman from Whiteville to understand street cred.

script.name: Liz
script.line: First of all, I'm not from Whiteville. I'm from White Haven. And it's not as nice as it sounds.

script.name: Liz
script.line: Fine. You can keep the tattoo. For this week only!

script.name: Man
script.line: Okay. Here we go.

script.name: Director
script.line: Quiet, please!

script.name: Man
script.line: Rehearsing.

script.name: Voice Over
script.line: And now a word from the White House.

script.name: Jenna
script.line: Good evening. I'm Laura Bush.

script.name: Tracy
script.line: And I'm Condoleezza Rice.

script.name: Pete
script.line: Well, we had a good run.

script.name: Jack
script.line: What the hell happened here?

script.name: Liz
script.line: The cast had a rough week.

script.name: Jack
script.line: These people cannot be on television. What is your contingency plan for a crap storm of this magnitude?

script.name: Liz
script.line: There is none.

script.name: Pete
script.line: We go live in a half an hour.

script.name: Jack
script.line: No wonder your career is being held back by a lack of foresight and an addiction to dysfunctional relationships. You have no exit strategies.

script.name: Pete
script.line: He knows about my marriage.

script.name: Liz
script.line: No. This is gonna be a bad show.
Worse than the time we let Tracy
do that tribute to August Wilson?
Worse than the time
we did that Gilbert and Sullivan parody.
Maybe we'll be preempted by some national news event.
It's still hurricane season, right?
Oh! A blackout. That will work.
All right, nobody panic.
The backup generator will kick in in just a few seconds.
Okay. You can panic.
This is real.
We dodged a bullet here tonight, Lemon.
Yes, this blackout is a fortunate coincidence.
You didn't do it, right?
What, you think I control the universe?
Yo!
This blackout messed me up.
I didn't get to debut my dragon face.
Can I do "The Today Show" tomorrow?
No, you're on a plane to Boston tomorrow, Tray.
We have a laboratory.
They're experimenting in tattoo removal.
It promises to be one of our biggest profit centers
once today's generation finally sobers up.
Tattoo's fake, Donaghy. Fake.
Street cred. He's a genius.
Flashlight, $20.
Flashlight, $20.
Can I give you a ride? Flashlight, $20.
No. I wouldn't want to crowd you.
Be strong, Lemon.
Don't let Dennis chew his way out of this one.
Flashlight, $20.
Can I borrow 20 bucks?
Flashlight, $20.
Dennis, wake up.
God.
Huh? What?
You're gonna burn the place down.
I wish I had burned the place down.
There's no reason to live anymore.
What happened?
The Islanders lost tonight.
Doesn't that happen a lot?
I knew you wouldn't understand.
So, how did it go?
He moved in with me.
Well, of course he did.
